key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares undercut the official site on 46.9% of itineraries despite a 7.3% week-over-week decline, highlighting persistent discount advantages on this channel.
MSE fares were lower for 97.20% of itineraries last week, delivering an average 0.13% discount versus the website and underscoring its dominant discount positioning.
GDS fares matched EgyptAir’s website in 68.3% of cases and offered discounts on nearly 25% of itineraries, with minimal premiums, demonstrating strong overall price alignment.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Despite a 7.3% week-over-week decline, OTA prices undercut the website on 46.9% of itineraries last week, confirming a persistent discount advantage on this channel.
Fares matching between the website and OTA grew 7.3% month-over-month to 37.6% of itineraries last week, signaling increasing pricing alignment.
Instances where OTA rates exceed the website fell 7.5% versus last month to 13.0% of itineraries, with a moderate average premium of 0.70%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Unavailable OTA offers comprised just 2.6% of itineraries last week, up 0.2% WoW but down 0.6% MoM, indicating stable data coverage.
Price parity on OTA rose 5.6% WoW and 7.3% MoM to 37.6% of itineraries, with an average difference of –0.01%, reflecting converging rates.
Premiums on OTA represented 12.96% of itineraries last week, up 1.5% WoW yet down 7.5% MoM, posting a modest average markup of 0.70%.
Channel undercuts applied to 46.87% of itineraries, despite a 7.3% WoW drop and 0.9% MoM rise, delivering an average discount of 0.07%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirror overall OTA patterns: 46.9% undercuts (–7.3% WoW), 37.6% parity (+5.6% WoW) and 13.0% premiums (+1.5% WoW), underscoring consistency across haul.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Egypt origins, parity grew 8.1% WoW to 46.3% of itineraries, while undercuts fell 9.8% WoW to 34.9%, with an average premium of 0.73% and average discount of 0.02%.
Non-Egypt origins saw 77.5% undercuts (–1.7% WoW), stable parity at 15.5% and minimal premiums at 2.3%, indicating stronger OTA discounts abroad.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings featured 45.2% undercuts (–7.4% WoW), 33.8% parity (+4.5% WoW) and 17.2% premiums (+2.4% WoW), with average discount of 0.08% and premium of 0.69%.
Far-out bookings delivered 49.1% undercuts (–7.7% WoW), 44.0% parity (+7.5% WoW) and 5.7% premiums (–0.3% WoW), reflecting greater alignment with website fares for long-lead time.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE fares were lower for 97.20% of itineraries last week, delivering an average discount of 0.13% versus EgyptAir’s website.
Instances of identical pricing climbed to 2.59% last week, up 151% from the prior week and 194% from the previous month.
Average fare differences remain minimal, with the month-over-month discount widening slightly from 0.11% to 0.13%.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website offers were unavailable on MSE in just 0.22% of cases last week, unchanged versus the prior month.
Exact price matches on MSE reached 2.59% last week, marking a 151% week-over-week increase.
MSE prices were lower in 97.20% of cases last week, a slight 1.94% decrease in share compared with the previous month.
There were zero instances of MSE fares exceeding those on EgyptAir’s website during the latest week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries saw MSE discounts in 97.20% of cases last week, with an average 0.13% price advantage over the website.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Egypt departures, 96.43% of itineraries were priced lower on MSE, with a 0.08% average discount and parity rising to 3.27%.
Non-Egyptian origin pairs saw MSE pricing lower 99.22% of the time, yielding a 0.24% average discount and a 0.78% parity rate.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in purchases (≤30 days) featured MSE discounts in 96.19% of cases, with a 0.14% average price advantage and parity at 3.81%.
Far-out bookings (>30 days) recorded lower MSE fares for 98.86% of itineraries, averaging a 0.11% discount over the website.

gds_highlights.line_content: 68.3% of GDS itineraries matched EgyptAir’s website last week, marking a 2.0pp week-over-week increase as price alignment remains the prevailing pattern.
Nearly 25% of GDS fares were lower than the site last week, with an average 0.17% discount despite a slight 0.75pp WoW pullback and a 1.7pp MoM gain.
Only 1.9% of GDS fares exceeded website prices, averaging a 0.14% premium and edging down 0.21pp from the prior week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Missing offers represented 4.97% of itineraries last week, down 1.05pp WoW and 0.39pp MoM, indicating marginally improved availability.
Fare parity reached 68.25% last week, up 2.01pp WoW but down 1.99pp MoM, underscoring stable alignment overall.
Discounted GDS fares accounted for 24.84% of cases, a 0.75pp WoW decline, with an average price reduction of 0.17%.
Premium fares comprised 1.94% of listings, down 0.21pp WoW, carrying a nominal 0.14% average increase over site prices.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries mirror overall GDS behavior with 68.3% parity, 24.8% discounts and sub-2% premiums, reflecting consistent cross-haul pricing alignment.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Egypt-origin routes show 74.6% parity (up 1.0pp WoW), 22.1% lower fares at a 0.10% average discount and only 1.8% premiums, indicating strong local alignment.
Non-Egypt ODs present 51.9% parity (up 4.3pp WoW), 31.8% discounts down 5.1pp WoW with a 0.28% average price cut and elevated absence rates at 13.9%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Within 0–14 days, 64.7% of GDS fares matched the site, 29.8% were cheaper by 0.16% on average and 2.8% were absent, underscoring tight short-term parity.
Bookings made >14 days out achieved 73.7% parity (up 3.9pp WoW), 17.1% discounts averaging 0.18% and reduced missing offers at 8.6%.
